channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: Elon Musk’s SpaceX and xAI in talks to merge, report says
item.description: This merger would bring the Grok chatbot, Starlink satellites, and SpaceX rockets together under one corporation.

item.title: Apple’s second biggest acquisition ever is an AI company that listens to ‘silent speech’
item.description: Apple's biggest acquisition ever is still its $3 billion Beats buy in 2014, but now the second biggest deal is bringing in Q.ai, a four-year-old AI audio startup. Apple did not disclose the terms, but Financial Times reports that Apple is spending $2 billion on the company. It also mentioned Q.ai patents for optical sensor […]

item.title: Tesla Applies for Trademarks on ‘Cybercar’ and ‘Cybervehicle,’ But What Do They Mean?
item.description: Place your bets now.

item.title: Obsbot’s new gimbal webcam doesn’t justify its $350 price
item.description: Webcam company Obsbot recently launched two new gimbal-equipped webcams, the $349 Tiny 3 and the $199 Tiny 3 Lite. It claims that the priciest model is the smallest pan, tilt, zoom (PTZ) 4K webcam ever made, weighing 63 grams. Ironically, the Tiny 3 Lite is heavier and bigger. I've been testing the Tiny 3 for […]

item.title: AI-Generated Anti-ICE Videos Are Getting the Fanfic Treatment
item.description: Across Instagram and Facebook, AI-generated videos show people of color putting ICE agents in their place. Are they cathartic or just adding to a stew of misinformation?

item.title: Dating apps Bumble and Match reportedly hit in cyberattack - user data potentially stolen, here's what we know
item.description: ShinyHunters strike again, and this time they're targeting dating apps.

item.title: New ‘Masters of the Universe’ Toys Will Power You Up for the Movie
item.description: While you're getting excited to see He-Man on the big screen this summer, Mattel hopes you'll keep that love going for its action figures.

item.title: Apple acquires Q.ai for a reported $2 billion
item.description: Apple has acquired Israel-based startup Q.ai, a move that could provide a much-needed boost to the tech giant's capabilities in artificial intelligence. Although Apple has not disclosed terms of the deal, sources told Financial Times that the arrangement is reportedly valued at nearly $2 billion. If that figure is accurate, the Q.ai acquisition marks Apple's second largest acquisition to date, followed by its purchase of Beats for $3 billion back in 2014.Johny Srouji, Apple’s senior vice president of hardware technologies, said in a statement that Q.ai "is a remarkable company that is pioneeri...

item.title: A Yann LeCun–Linked Startup Charts a New Path to AGI
item.description: As the world’s largest companies pour hundreds of billions of dollars into large language models, San Francisco-based Logical Intelligence is trying something different in pursuit of AI that can mimic the human brain.

item.title: It's not a myth – Capcom has fixed Monster Hunter Wilds, and I even tested it to find out
item.description: Capcom's Monster Hunter Wilds performance patch fixes the game's frustrating stuttering issues, but don't expect a miraculous frame rate hike.

item.title: Apple buys Israeli startup Q.ai as the AI race heats up
item.description: Q.ai is an Israeli startup specializing in imaging and machine learning, particularly technologies that enable devices to interpret whispered speech and enhance audio in noisy environments.

item.title: It’s a Big Week for Google Privacy Violation Settlements
item.description: Get your money since you can't have your privacy.

item.title: Music publishers sue Anthropic for $3 billion over ‘flagrant piracy’
item.description: A group of music publishers led by Concord Music Group and Universal Music Group are suing Anthropic, according to a report by Reuters. The suit accuses the AI company of illegally downloading more than 20,000 copyrighted songs, including sheet music, lyrics and compositions. These songs were then allegedly fed into the chatbot Claude for training purposes. There are some iconic tunes named by Universal in the suit, including tracks by The Rolling Stones, Neil Diamond and Elton John, among many others. Concord is an independent publisher that handles artists like Common, Killer Mike and Korn. ...

item.title: Our Favorite Open Earbuds Are $60 Off
item.description: The Anker Soundcore Aeroclip earbuds boast great sound without cutting you off from the outside world.

item.title: Everything is gambling now: the latest news on prediction markets like Polymarket and Kalshi
item.description: Prediction markets will let you bet on just about anything, from how many tweets Elon Musk will post this week to the next president of the United States, with predictions sometimes showing shockingly (or suspiciously) spot-on accuracy. Polymarket’s CEO Shayne Copland has even claimed that prediction markets are “the most accurate thing we have as […]...

item.title: Google's Project Genie lets you generate your own interactive worlds
item.description: This past summer, Google DeepMind debuted Genie 3. It’s what’s known as a world world, an AI system capable of generating images and reacting as the user moves through the environment the software is simulating. At the time, DeepMind positioned Genie 3 as a tool for training AI agents. Now, it’s making the model available to people outside of Google to try with Project Genie. To start, you’ll need Google’s $250 per month AI Ultra plan to check out Project Genie. You’ll also need to live in the US and be 18 years or older. At launch, Project Genie offers three different modes of interaction: Wo...

item.title: Top antivirus hacked to push out a malicious update - find out if you're affected
item.description: Popular antivirus program eScan was used as a malware launchpad, deploying a backdoor to a small subset of users.

item.title: Apple achète pour 2 milliards une IA qui lit sur les visages
item.description: Contrairement à d'autres grandes entreprises de la tech, Apple s'abstient de dépenser sans compter pour acquérir des sociétés. Mais il arrive de temps en temps que la firme à la pomme signe des chèques qui dépassent le milliard de dollars pour s'offrir des technologies et des talents indispensables à ses projets. C'est le cas aujourd'hui avec Q.AI.

item.title: The Garmin Venu X1 is back down to its lowest-ever price, with 25% shaved off Garmin's slimmest smartwatch
item.description: Save a fat $200 on a slim Garmin Venu X1 — at this price, I'd get it over an Apple Watch Ultra 3.

item.title: Major baby food company recalls ‘crawler snacks’ nationwide. Watch out for these products
item.description: The cookie-like snacks are being yanked from shelves after it was discovered that they may contain soft plastic or pieces of paper. Here’s what to know. Virginia-based Gerber Products Company is voluntarily recalling limited batches of Gerber Arrowroot Biscuits, a cookie-like snack meant for children 10 months or older.

item.title: Bitcoin price plunge: Why are crypto prices dropping this time?
item.description: Cryptocurrencies took a big hit on Thursday with Bitcoin reaching its lowest point of the year so far.

item.title: The Computer History Museum’s New Online Portal Is a Nerd’s Dream Come True
item.description: It's the next best thing to an IRL visit.

item.title: ICE Pretends It’s a Military Force. Its Tactics Would Get Real Soldiers Killed
item.description: WIRED asked an active military officer to break down immigration enforcement actions in Minneapolis and elsewhere.

item.title: 'It’s an awesome robot. It looks like a human. People could be easily confused that it’s a human' — Tesla exec on why Optimus 3 is a game changer
item.description: Tesla makes big shift to focus on AI and robotics, promising a very human-like Optimus 3 by March — but what does that really mean?

item.title: You’re not alone in feeling unprepared for the AI boom
item.description: Even Dario Amodei, the co-founder and CEO of Anthropic, has been shaken by the increasing power of AI tools. Journalist Ira Glass, who hosts the NPR show “This American Life,” is not a computer scientist. He doesn’t work at Google, Apple, or Nvidia. But he does have a great ear for useful phrases, and in 2024, he organized an entire episode around one that might resonate with anyone who feels blindsided by the pace of AI development: “Unprepared for what has already happened.”...

item.title: ‘Absolute Batman’ Is the Batman We Deserve in 2026
item.description: Now is the perfect time to dive into Scott Snyder and Nick Dragotta's generational DC Comics run in 'Absolute Batman.'

item.title: Napster’s back — and its new AI-first app wants you to help create the music, not just listen to it
item.description: Napster is back and this time as an AI-powered music platform betting that the future of audio is co-creation, not passive listening.

item.title: Une « tour » de panneaux solaires va enfin alimenter une base lunaire
item.description: Pour répondre aux enjeux énergétiques croissants des missions lunaires, la Nasa s'associe à Astrobotic pour développer le VSAT-XL (Extra Large Vertical Solar Array Technology). Conçu pour le pôle sud de la Lune, ce système de panneaux solaires promet de révolutionner la production d'énergie...

item.title: How to watch the 2026 Super Bowl: Patriots vs. Seahawks channel, start time, where to stream and more
item.description:
The New England Patriots are headed to the 2026 Super Bowl. (Lauren Leigh Bacho via Getty Images)
Lauren Leigh Bacho via Getty Images
Drake Maye and the New England Patriots face Sam Darnold and the Seattle Seahawks at Super Bowl LX, which will be held at Levi's Stadium in Santa Clara, CA this year. For those of you who don't have your calendars blocked off already, the game is on February 8, with kickoff scheduled for 6:30 p.m. ET. Like all other Sunday Night Football games this season, the championship game will be broadcast on NBC, and will stream live on Peacock. (Oh, and in ...

item.title: Waymo robotaxis are now giving rides to and from San Francisco International Airport
item.description: Waymo's SFO win comes as the company faces criticism and concerns about safety in some of the cities it operates.

item.title: Stay prepared in any emergency with over $1,000 off the Anker Solix F2000
item.description: As of Jan. 29, get over $1,000 off the Anker Solix F2000 at Amazon.

item.title: This Fire TV offers all you need if you want a basic 4K TV for under $300
item.description: Amazon’s 4K Fire TV hits an all-time low price

item.title: Maingear's latest retro gaming desktop takes you back to the Quake era
item.description: Maingear is back with another nostalgia-fueled gaming PC. The Retro98 may look like it's made for playing Quake while you wait for The Phantom Menace trailer to drop. But on the inside, the beige box is powerful enough to slay today's most demanding AAA games. "You're not going to find this PC at your local Radio Shack," Maingear promises.If you're at least middle-aged, the Retro98's exterior is instantly familiar. The hand-built tower includes an LED fan-speed display, a working turbo button and a power-lockout key. Sticking with the nostalgic motif, its front I/O is hidden behind the Maingea...

item.title: OpenAI Working on Social Media Network That Could Require Creepy Eye Scans: Report
item.description: Signing up for the bot-free platform will reportedly require submitting some biometric data.

item.title: Spotify has a group messaging feature now
item.description: Spotify is adding group chats to the messaging service it premiered last year. In an addendum to the original blog post introducing Messages, the company announced that users can initiate chats with up to 10 of their friends to share the podcasts, playlists and songs they are listening to. The in-app messaging feature, which was released last August, works to keep users on the app instead of navigating to another platform to share content with friends. Since its introduction, Spotify has added functionality bit by bit. Earlier this month, the company added the ability to share what you're list...

item.title: Spotify’s new group chats share music with everyone in your circle
item.description: Spotify is expanding its in-app messaging feature with group chats. Now you can add up to 10 friends and family members to your discussion about your new favorite song, podcast, or audiobook, as reported earlier by TechCrunch. The music streaming platform launched direct messaging last August, allowing you to share what you're listening to without […]...

item.title: The powerful M5 iPad Pro is sitting at its lowest price ever — save $100 at Amazon
item.description: The 11-inch M5 iPad Pro is on sale at Amazon for $899, down from the list price of $999. That's a 10% discount.
